channel.title: CVE Feed for Linux -- kernel:
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Linux -- kernel:

item.title: CVE-2017-2634|2024-08-05T14:02:06.941Z -- linux -- kernel%3A
item.description: It was found that the Linux kernel's Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) implementation before 2.6.22.17 used the IPv4-only inet_sk_rebuild_header() function for both IPv4 and IPv6 DCCP connections, which could result in memory corruptions. A remote attacker could use this flaw to crash the system.
